name: Special Preview Screening of Agra
description: Agra is an indie film directed by Kanu Behl - is among the few Indian film directors to have both his films consecutively showcased in Cannes. Agra had its world premier at Directors’ Fortnight in Cannes in 2023 and is finally releasing in pan India on Nov 14th across 100 screens. We will begin the screening 15 minutes after the scheduled time. The film has a runtime of 2 hours and 7 minutes with no interval, so please be seated before it begins.We also request everyone to maintain theatre-viewing decorum — kindly keep your phones on silent and avoid using them during the screening. ⚠ Viewer Discretion Advised: This is an adults-only film. No minors will be allowed entry. Thank you for your cooperation and for being part of this special evening. RSVP - Sooraj | +90 9605330463 |  sooraj@thevibe.me

name: Desdemona Roopakam - Feminist Narratives Within Shakespeare’s Othello and Traditional Indian Mythologies
Archaeological Landscapes and Heritage Monuments - Contextualizing the Long-Term History of Maski
description: Archaeological Landscapes and Heritage Monuments: Contextualizing the Long-Term History of Maski Dr. Bauer will present findings from over 20 years of archaeological research in northern Karnataka, focusing on the long-term history of Maski (Raichur District)—known for its Ashokan Edict and earlier occupations—and the megalithic site of Hire Benakal (Koppal District). His talk explores how these sites are understood within the broader cultural landscapes of ancient activities and practices.  Andrew Bauer, an anthropological archaeologist at Stanford University, conducts research in South India examining how landscape history, cultural practices, and social inequalities evolved from the Neolithic to the Medieval periods. He also explores how landscape histories intersect with modern ideas of nature, conservation, and climate change.

Season - A Film By R.V. Ramani
description: SEASON 180 Minutes, Tamil, English with (English Subtitled), 1997 Photographed, Directed and Produced by R.V. Ramani Edited by Amitabh Chakraborty. Synopsis: In the Tamil month ‘Margazhi’, (Dec/Jan), Chennai hosts the festival of classical music and dance, popularly known as the December Season, organized by various Sabhas, featuring more than 1000 performances and related events across the city. Journeying through the ambience of the 1996 December Season, being with artists, before/during/after their performances, the film attempts to portray the very essence of the culture that prevails during the Season. FILMMAKER AND HIS MOTIVATION: R.V. Ramani, is an Award-winning filmmaker, makes films exploring various aspects of expression, in a candid, explorative and deeply subjective approach. With more than 30 independent films to his credit, he is created a niche for himself, in the Documentary/Avant- garde films in India. On the film ‘Season’ he says, ‘The idea for ‘Season’, probably began after hearing the concert by flautist T. Vishwanathan (Vishwa), in 1989. His music and presence deeply moved me, especially in the way he transforms a performance space into an intimate space. When he received his Sangita Kalanidhi award in 1996, I felt compelled to film with him and also journey through the ambience of the Season, filming with many artists.” FEATURED ARTISTES: Vishwanathan T, Vidhya Sridhar , Unnikrishnan, Sudha Raghunathan, Srilatha Suresh, Sowmya S, Sikkil Sisters, Shobana, Seshagopalan TN , Semmangudi Srinivasa Iyer , Sashank MS, Sanjay Subramaniam, Ravikiran N, Neiveli Santanagopalan, Leela Samson, Lakshmi Knight, Krishna TM, Kelucharan Mahapatra, Kanyakumari A , Kadri Gopalnath , Gayathri E , Chitra Visweswaran, Bombay Jayashree, Balamurali Krishna, Aruna Sayeeram, Anita Ratnam, Amjad Ali Khan and many more.
